info.title: Orders API
info.description: VTEX OMS is the module in charge of Order Management, Affiliate configuration and Recurring Orders.

post.description: Change a Status Order to start-handling by Order ID. For example: in case you need change to {{start-handling}} the order status of order Id {{v5025004rjc-09}}, you will have to replace the variables {{orderId}} for {{v5025004rjc-09}} and status to {{start-handling}}

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

post.description:
You should use this endpoint to cancel an order by its order identification number (the `orderId`).

A common scenario is one where the seller has a problem with the order fulfillment and needs to request the order cancellation to the marketplace. To do this, the seller would need to make this request, passing the `orderId` in the URL.

There should be no body in this request.

You should expect a response with the date when the notification was received, the orderId, and a receipt protocol code.

Be aware that if the order status is already `Invoiced`, the order can only be canceled if‚Äîbefore using this request‚Äîyou send a return invoice through the [Order Invoice Notification endpoint](https://developers.vtex.com/reference/invoice#invoicenotification).

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account where the order will be canceled. It is used as part of the URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used as part of the request URL.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: ID that identifies the order in the seller.

post.description: Register an order change of product or amount. Order status that allows Order Change: {{handling}}, {{waiting-for-fulfillment}}, and {{ready-for-invoicing}}.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

get.description: Retrieve an order attachment, by its name and order ID. For example, in case you need to get an attachment from order ID {{v5025004rjc-09}}, you should replace the variables {{orderId}} for {{v5025004rjc-09}} and {{attachmentName}} for the correspondent name of the attachment you're searching for.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

post.description:
Once the order is invoiced, the seller should use this request to send the invoice information to the marketplace.

We strongly recommend that you always send the object of the invoiced items. With this practice, rounding errors will be avoided.

It is not allowed to use the same `invoiceNumber` in more than one request to the Order Invoice Notification endpoint.

Be aware that this endpoint is also used by the seller to send the order tracking information. This, however, should be done in a separate moment, once the seller has the tracking information.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account to which you want to send the invoice information. It is used as part of the request URL.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to be used as part of the request URL.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: String that identifies the order whose invoice is being sent.

patch.summary: Update Order's partial invoice (Send Tracking Number)
patch.description: Update invoice of a given order, with its tracking number.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL

example.lastMessageUnread: Lux Store 96 Sua Nota Fiscal foi emitida. Referente ao Pedido #v502559llux-01 Ol√°, J. Estamos empacotando seu produto para providenci

requestId.description: Request identification that is useful when more than one request is made for the same change. VTEX identifies all of these requests as a single one through the requestId. If you need two or more equal requests to be understood as retries of the same request, you must use the same requestId for all of these requests.

type.description: The type of invoice. There are two possible values: **Output** and **Input**. The Output type should be used when the invoice you are sending is a selling invoice. The Input type should be used when you send a return invoice.

courier.description: The name of the carrier responsible for delivering the order. *This field should only be used when sending the **tracking** information. When the request is used for sending the invoice, this field should be left empty (`""`).*

trackingNumber.description: The number code that identifies the order tracking. *This field should only be used when sending the **tracking** information. When the request is used for sending the invoice, this field should be left empty (`""`).*

trackingUrl.description: The URL used to track the order. *This field should only be used when sending the **tracking** information. When the request is used for sending the invoice, this field should be left empty (`""`).*

items.description: Array containing the SKUs that are being invoiced.

id.description: ID of the SKU being invoiced.

price.description: Total price of the SKU being invoiced.

quantity.description: Quantity currently in inventory of the SKU being invoiced.
